Sentence: When Joe leaves, the ghost of Ethel herself appears, having come to witness Roy's last days on earth
Ethel comes to observe him (Joe) in his (Joe) misery
Roy nears his (Roy) end as well, reeling from Joe's disclosure and from Ethel's news that he (Joe) has been disbarred
He (Joe) dies, but not before tricking Ethel into tenderly singing for him (Joe)
